title: How to Activate a Verizon Cell Phone

steps.title: Power on your new iPhone.
steps.content: Power on your new iPhone. The power button is on the right. After the initial startup “apple” you will be taken to the Activation screen.

steps.title: Confirm your phone number.
steps.content: Confirm your phone number. This will be displayed on the page. If it matches your expectations you can proceed, otherwise contact Verizon support.

steps.title: Tap Next.
steps.content: Tap Next .

steps.title: Enter the password of the Verizon billing account.
steps.content: Enter the password of the Verizon billing account. You may also be able to enter the last four digits of the social security number associated with the billing information on the account instead.

steps.title: Tap Next.
steps.content: Tap Next .

steps.title: Wait for your iPhone to activate.
steps.content: Wait for your iPhone to activate. If you receive a SIM card error, ensure that you have the correct SIM card inserted in the iPhone.

steps.title: Proceed with iPhone setup.
steps.content: Proceed with iPhone setup. With activation complete, you will be prompted to finish configuring your device preferences. See Activate-an-iPhone for more information.

steps.title: Power on your new device.
steps.content: Power on your new device. If you're activating a used device, make sure to insert your own SIM card first.

steps.title: Select a Language.
steps.content: Select a Language.

steps.title: Tap Next.
steps.content: Tap Next . This button appears in the lower right.

steps.title: Tap Activate Now.
steps.content: Tap Activate Now . This button may also appear as Next . Activation amy begin automatically. If not you will be prompted for Verizon account information before proceeding..

steps.title: Power Off your old Verizon device.
steps.content: Power Off your old Verizon device. Verizon will automatically deactivate your old device if necessary. Once powered off, you must wait several seconds for the device to finish deactivating. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Enter the password of the Verizon billing account (if prompted).
steps.content: Enter the password of the Verizon billing account (if prompted). You may also be able to enter the last four digits of the social security number associated with the billing information on the account instead.

steps.title: Complete the initial device setup.
steps.content: Complete the initial device setup. You will be prompted to setup various accounts or services to start using your device. You can read more here or tap the ⏭ Skip option on each page to do it later. Your phone will be activated and ready to use.

steps.title: Ensure that your device will be compatible.
steps.content: Ensure that your device will be compatible. Go to https://www.verizonwireless.com/bring-your-own-device/ in your web browser. The page includes step by step instructions for locating and verifying the necessary information on your device to determine if it will function with the Verizon network.

steps.title: Navigate to https://www.verizonwireless.com/vzw/browse/devicechange/home.jsp.
steps.content: Navigate to https://www.verizonwireless.com/vzw/browse/devicechange/home.jsp . If not already logged in, you will be prompted for your Verizon username and password.

steps.title: Click Activate a device on an existing line.
steps.content: Click Activate a device on an existing line . You will be taken to a list of devices on your account.

steps.title: Click the line you want to activate the device on.
steps.content: Click the line you want to activate the device on.

steps.title: Select Yes or No.
steps.content: Select Yes or No . Choose Yes if this device has been used previously on your Verizon account. Otherwise choose No .

steps.title: Enter your Device ID (if No).
steps.content: Enter your Device ID (if No). The page for this selection mirrors that in the first step. Once your device is confirmed as compatible, you can proceed.

steps.title: Select another phone on your account.
steps.content: Select another phone on your account. For authorization purposes, Verizon will send you a code via text message to another phone associated with your account If no other phone line exists on your account or is active, you will need to contact customer service to complete the switch. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Text Me the Code.
steps.content: Click Text Me the Code . After a few moments, the authorization code will be sent to the selected line.

steps.title: Enter the code from the text message.
steps.content: Enter the code from the text message. This information goes into the Online Authorization Code field.

steps.title: Click Confirm.
steps.content: Click Confirm . You will be prompted to confirm the compatibility of your SIM card. If you do not have a SIM card or know it is compatible, then you can skip the next step. If you do not have one, you will need to purchase one in order to use your phone with Verizon.

steps.title: Enter your SIM ID number.
steps.content: Enter your SIM ID number. You can find instructions for locating this information by clicking “Finding Your SIM Card and SIM ID”

steps.title: Click Check ID.
steps.content: Click Check ID .

steps.title: Select an equipment protection option (if prompted).
steps.content: Select an equipment protection option (if prompted). This options will only appear if you previously had equipment protection or have recently upgraded.

steps.title: Click Confirm.
steps.content: Click Confirm .

steps.title: Select a compatible service plan (if prompted).
steps.content: Select a compatible service plan (if prompted). This option will only appear if the device you're activating is not compatible with your current plan.

steps.title: Click Confirm Feature & Plan Changes.
steps.content: Click Confirm Feature & Plan Changes . Your device activation is now complete.

steps.title: Purchase a Verizon SIM card if you don't have one.
steps.content: Purchase a Verizon SIM card if you don't have one. You will need a SIM card in order to connect to the 4G LTE network. You can order one from the Verizon website, by calling the Customer Service line, or by visiting a Verizon store.

steps.title: Get your device's IMEI number.
steps.content: Get your device's IMEI number. You can get the IMEI number for most phones by dialing *#06#. You may be prompted for this number during the activation process.

steps.title: Call (800) 837-4966.
steps.content: Call (800) 837-4966. This is Verizon's Customer Service number, and the customer service rep can activate your phone for you. You may need to give your IMEI number as well as prove that you are the account holder.

steps.title: Visit a Verizon store.
steps.content: Visit a Verizon store. Most customer service reps should be able to activate your phone in just a few moments. Make sure to bring in your SIM card, or let the employee know that you need to purchase a new SIM card.
